reviews.text: We booked a hire car for the week but did not use it as the ferries were so reliable and much better than driving the narrow mountainous roads. In fact if we had known how easy it was to travel by train and ferry to Bellagio we wouldnt have bothered with a car as the trains run regularly from Bergamo to Varenna from where you can get one one of the regular ferries to Bellagio.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and absolutely loved it! The hotel is a boutique hotel up a flight of stairs. Right in the middle of town. We are so glad we stayed here instead of in Como. Bellagio is a cute, quaint town with lots of small streets and this hotel fits right in. We weren't able to get a lake view room but we still loved it. The rooms were clean and the hotel was modern. We lost our luggage at the beginning of our trip and the staff was extremely helpful dealing with the airlines and locating our bags. The breakfast was super tasty and the service was great. Don't miss this wonderful find in such an amazing city!
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Bellagio for seven nights in Jun/Jul of this year. This hotel went through an extensive remodeling a couple of years ago (according to the front desk personnel). Our room was on the top floor in the corner - #404. It offered great views of Lake Como. The hotel was exceptionally clean, and quiet for the most part. We did hear some noise from the streets below, but it was virtually quiet after 11PM at night. The hotel staff were very cordial and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned after staying at Hotel Bellagio for 3 nts. We had room 303 which had fabulous views across the lake. I wasn't expecting too much from the hotel which is just a 2 star 'boutique' hotel. The room we had was a very good size and very clean and a small flat screen LCD television. The most redeeming feature of the room is the lake view. Simply beautiful. I think the views from the 3rd and 4th floor are the ones to have.

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights at the end of December, between Christmas and New Year. Was one of only two hotels open (close season) so surprisingly busy, yet staff were still very hospitable and friendly. Looked recently refurbished and rooms were very clean and had full Sky/satellite tv. Even managed to watch Everton-Arsenal live in our room!! Would definately recommend.

reviews.text: Bellagio - Hotel Bellagio

reviews.title: Million Dollar View + Top Quality Lodging
reviews.text: This is another small hotel – well situated with great views in the picturesque village of Bellagio on Lake Como. We found them very responsive on our email bookings and friendly on check-in and English was excellent. The rooms were well furnished – well above their two star rating - but we missed not having even a bar fridge. Another disappointment was no internet – we don’t mind paying $100 per week for it, but to have none available seemed out of sync with 2008 traveler needs especially over Christmas when the shops were closed. We would definitely recommend this to others. The hotel web site photos were accurate.
When we decided to book a place on Lake Como, it was feast or famine regarding cost. It didn't seem like we'd find a place that would be above average and still afford it.
